title: PTD Today — Media

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Daniel Tom, 31, owns and operates Bay Area Sanitation, a company managing nearly 2,000 portable toilets across the San Francisco Bay Area. The business reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025 and serves construction sites and events.
bullets: Owner: Daniel Tom, age 31
Company: Bay Area Sanitation
Fleet: almost 2,000 portable toilets
Service area: San Francisco Bay Area — construction sites and events
2025 income: $4.3 million
takeaways: A large, scalable sanitation operation (≈2,000 units) indicates significant logistical capability that can support large or distributed projects.
For Bay Area facilities or construction projects, local vendors exist with proven capacity and revenue to meet sustained sanitation needs.
Contracting established regional providers may reduce operational risk during site builds, maintenance, or events given their demonstrated scale.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description… Jo discovers the power of Copilot Groups, showing that route planning can be made easy. The short clip highlights Copilot (Microsoft Copilot) as an AI tool for simplifying route planning.
bullets: Jo uses Copilot Groups to simplify route planning.
Primary message: route planning made easy.
Highlights Copilot / Microsoft Copilot branding.
Includes hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai.
No transcript is available for additional detail.
takeaways: If route planning is part of your operations, Copilot Groups may help streamline crew routing and planning workflows.
Consider evaluating Copilot Groups in a small pilot to see potential time savings and coordination benefits.
Assess integration needs with existing scheduling, GIS, and dispatch systems before wider rollout.
Ensure appropriate data access controls and security measures when sharing route and group information with AI tools.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… The KPMG ON AIR podcast episode features Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska explaining how AI tools are already integrated into audit workflows—supporting repetitive tasks, analysing full data populations and improving decision-making. They outline specific solutions (AI Transaction Scoring, Clara AI, KPMG Clara), benefits for clients, shifts in auditor roles and competencies, and considerations around data security, regulation and implementation risks.
bullets: AI is applied across audit tasks: transaction scoring, conversational assistants (Clara AI) and automated disclosure analysis.
Shift from sampling to analysis of full populations enables more comprehensive testing and real-time audit management via KPMG Clara.
Clara for Clients improves modern client–auditor communication and collaboration.
Adoption changes the auditor’s role and requires new competencies and adaptation.
Implementation raises topics of data security, regulatory compliance and potential AI-related risks.
takeaways: Expect audits to become more data‑driven and comprehensive—prepare complete, well-structured datasets to reduce sampling gaps.
Ensure strong data governance and security controls, since AI-enabled audits increase reliance on large datasets and integrations.
Leverage client-facing audit platforms for faster, clearer communication with auditors and to streamline evidence exchange.
Plan for stakeholder upskilling and alignment with auditors on formats, access and automation to minimize implementation friction.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer spotlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The 3D real-time strategy RPG puts you in the role of the Endministrator on Talos-II, and the trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield launch trailer features NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Game is a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator of Endfield Industries on Talos-II.
Trailer capture: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra settings, DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Official links provided for DLSS 4 details and the game's site.
NVIDIA GeForce promoted the release across its social and community channels.
takeaways: Adoption of DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation indicates new GPU features to consider when provisioning hardware for high-fidelity real-time rendering workloads.
High-resolution capture on an RTX 5080 underscores demand for top-tier GPUs to support 4K game streaming, benchmarking, and content creation.
Games integrating DLSS 4 may increase the value of GPUs that support frame-generation techniques for cloud gaming and remote-rendering services.
